}}'''Texas Southern University''' (also referred to as '''Texas Southern''' or '''TSU''') is a [[Historically Black Colleges and Universities|historically black university]] located in [[Houston, Texas]]. Established on March 3, 1947 by the [[Texas Legislature]], it was initially named Texas State University for Negroes. Prior to becoming a [[state university]], Texas Southern was owned by the [[Houston Independent School District]] (HISD) and had been known as Houston College for Negroes.
}}'''Texas Southern University''' (also referred to as '''Texas Southern''' or '''TSU''') is a [[Historically Black Colleges and Universities|historically black university]] located in [[Houston, Texas]]. Established on March 3, 1947 by the [[Texas Legislature]], it was initially named Texas State University for Negroes. Prior to becoming a [[state university]], Texas Southern was owned by the [[Houston Independent School District]] (HISD) and had been known as Houston College for Negroes.
Line 132: Line 132:
|}
|}
===Athletics===
===Athletics===
  +
[[File:TexasSouthernTigers.png|thumb|right|Athletics logo]]
Texas Southern University's school colors are [[Maroon (color)|maroon]] and [[Grey|gray]] and the school's mascot is the Tiger. Texas Southern sports teams participate in [[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]] [[Division I]] (Championship Subdivision for football) in the [[Southwestern Athletic Conference]] (SWAC).
Texas Southern University's school colors are [[Maroon (color)|maroon]] and [[Grey|gray]] and the school's mascot is the Tiger. Texas Southern sports teams participate in [[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]] [[Division I]] (Championship Subdivision for football) in the [[Southwestern Athletic Conference]] (SWAC).
